text:
Kelly Clarkson is easily one of our favorite coaches on The Voice. The singer is honest, obsessed with her team, and packs some seriously impressive style goals to boot. During the elimination night for the Top 11, she made it even more apparent that she’s her contestants' biggest fan in just one comment caught on camera.

This content is imported from poll. You may be able to find the same content in another format, or you may be able to find more information, at their web site.

Though Sarah Grace and Kymberli Joye were saved by America’s votes, Kelly’s other charges, Chevel Shepherd and Lynnea Moorer, were two of the last three on the stage. Fortunately for 16-year-old Chevel—who continues to stun viewers week after week—host Carson Daly called her name, securing her spot in the top 10.

The Voice The Voice STREAM NOW

Kelly was, of course, thrilled that Chevel was moving forward, and immediately hopped up to give the young artist a big hug—and some reassurance.

“It’s not in any order,” she quickly told Chevel, who fanned herself as she joined her coach. Chevel responded, “OK,” and then told Kelly, “Love you!” (See the sweet moment at 29:01 here.)

Kelly clearly wanted her protégé to understand that she shouldn’t take her standing on the elimination show to mean she’s in last place in the voter’s hearts. And Kelly’s not the only one who reached out to the talented teen to let her know she’s a front-runner in the competition.

This content is imported from twitter. You may be able to find the same content in another format, or you may be able to find more information, at their web site. I’m a day late but WOW Chevel Shepherd was incredible on @NBCTheVoice last night!!! Perfect song choice 👌🏼👌🏼👌🏼👌🏼 #spacecowboy #teamkelly @KaceyMusgraves @kelly_clarkson — Josh McCoy (@JoshuaMac22) November 27, 2018

This content is imported from twitter. You may be able to find the same content in another format, or you may be able to find more information, at their web site. #TheVoice...👏👏#Chevel Shepherd top 10. WOOHOO!! You got this girl🎤🎶 — Natasha Yazzie (@YazzieNatasha) November 28, 2018

Sadly, Kelly didn’t win all around on Tuesday. After performing Ariana Grande’s “Tattooed Heart,” Lynnea (who caused quite the controversy when she joined the series from the Comeback Stage this year) was sent home, and DeAndre Nico from Team Adam Levine moved on in her place. But despite losing Lynnea, Kelly still has three powerhouse performers on her side. Blake Shelton might be calling her Queen Kelly for another year, after all!
title: 'The Voice' Coach Kelly Clarkson Whispered a Show Secret to Chevel Shepherd

meta_data.description: After making it to the top 10 during The Voice eliminations, coach Kelly Clarskon hopped out of her chair to hug 16-year-old artist Chevel Shepherd, and reassure her that she was a frontrunner.
